item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 2:30 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (94 points | 19 comments)
2. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (80 points | 32 comments)
3. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (407 points | 146 comments)
4. Toward a Passwordless Future (22 points | 36 comments)
5. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (78 points | 36 comments)
6. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (130 points | 40 comments)
7. Deploy from local to production (self-hosted) (77 points | 38 comments)
8. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (197 points | 361 comments)
9. Zig's dot star syntax (value.*) (58 points | 43 comments)
10. MCP vs. API Explained (75 points | 44 comments)
11. Roald Dahl on the death of his daughter (2015) (14 points | 2 comments)
12. Volkswagen reintroducing physical controls for vital functions (292 points | 203 comments)
13. Discworld Rules (176 points | 216 comments)
14. Show HN: TypeLeap: LLM Powered Reactive Intent UI/UX (33 points | 15 comments)
15. Time for a Change: The long, contentious history of time shifts (19 points | 14 comments)
16. OneText (YC W23) is hiring a browser extension engineer ( | hide)
17. The program is the database is the interface (139 points | 44 comments)
18. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (602 points | 236 comments)
19. Social Media Posts About Medical Tests with Potential for Overdiagnosis (17 points | 11 comments)
20. The trap of the top-down approach (3 points | discuss)
21. Spark-TTS: Text-2-Speech Model Single-Stream Decoupled Tokens [pdf] (50 points | 1 comment)
22. Long Read: Lessons from Building Semantic Search for GitHub and Why I Failed (102 points | 26 comments)
23. Body Doubling (85 points | 67 comments)
24. You might not need Redis (155 points | 100 comments)
25. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (272 points | 150 comments)
26. Ultrasonic deep drawing cuts friction by 20%, extends tool lifespan (82 points | 25 comments)
27. Cobalt Networks CobaltOS: Proxmox Port (24 points | 6 comments)
28. Stuff a Pi-hole in your router because your browser is about to betray you (59 points | 31 comments)
29. An epic treatise on error models for systems programming languages (192 points | 63 comments)
30. Falkon: A KDE Web Browser (178 points | 94 comments)
